channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned shopping trolley, 15th May
item.description:
Shopping trolley in footpath leading from Old Pats field to Everest Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilford Avenue, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are numerous areas where the layer of tarmac has come away and left quite deep, large areas of holes. This runs pretty much down a 4 or 5 meters stretch of road, 15th May
item.description:
Outside Denham Close turning towards Apple Tree Close turning, unavoidable as there are that many
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pottersfield Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pothole runs most of the width of the road heading towards prestbury. Impossible to avoid as there are parked cars in the road so you have to go over it. I think this has been fixed previously, 15th May
item.description:
This is just before the butchers shop on the left hand side going toward Prestbury.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 15th May
item.description:
15/05/2025 email rcvd ::: I am expressing my concern with regard to the health of the almond tree outside 18- 20 Lyefield rd East Charlton Kings GL53 8AY. I returned home last night to find a large branch had fallen from the tree. It had blocked the pavement and just missed my car. My concern is it could have seriously injured a pedestrian, blocked the road and damaged a vehicle. It is a busy road having a school and a nursery nearby. I do hope you will take my concerns seriously and assess the tree as soon as possible. Yours sincerely
Report on FixMyStreet
